Description: Rim sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; top of rim glazed; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The sherd joins British Museum 1924, 1201.794 and belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.823. The number 4 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim; several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983 The sherd is also published in D. Bailey, 'Some Fresh Naukratis Joins', BSA 63 (1970) 3-4.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 169, no. 180)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 730, no. 904)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1847) (phase 2)
